title: Create Content Standards Request
description: Request parameters for creating a new content standards configuration

countries_all.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. Standards apply in ALL listed countries (AND logic).

channels_any.description: Advertising channels. Standards apply to ANY of the listed channels (OR logic).

languages_any.description: BCP 47 language tags (e.g., 'en', 'de', 'fr'). Standards apply to content in ANY of these languages (OR logic). Content in unlisted languages is not covered by these standards.

policy.description: Natural language policy describing acceptable and unacceptable content contexts. Used by LLMs and human reviewers to make judgments.

calibration_exemplars.description: Training/test set to calibrate policy interpretation. Supports simplified domain/URL references and full artifact definitions.

oneOf.description: Domain-level reference - all content on this domain passes

type.description: Indicates this is a domain-level reference

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for content on this domain

oneOf.description: URL-level reference - this specific page/content passes

type.description: Indicates this is a URL-level reference

value.description: Full URL to a specific page (e.g., 'https://espn.com/nba/story/_/id/12345/lakers-win')

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for content at this URL

oneOf.description: Full artifact definition for detailed calibration
Domain-level reference - all content on this domain fails

type.description: Indicates this is a domain-level reference

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for content on this domain

oneOf.description: URL-level reference - this specific page/content fails

type.description: Indicates this is a URL-level reference

value.description: Full URL to a specific page (e.g., 'https://news.example.com/controversial-article')

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for content at this URL

oneOf.description: Full artifact definition for detailed calibration

floor.description: Safety floor baseline - a reference to an external floor definition. Floors are typically industry-standard (e.g., GARM categories) or vendor-defined (e.g., IAS, DoubleVerify) and define universal content exclusions that apply regardless of brand-specific policy. The seller agent retrieves the floor definition from the URL to understand what categories/ratings to implement.

url.description: URL to the floor definition document (e.g., GARM floor, vendor-specific floor). The document at this URL defines content categories and exclusion criteria.

name.description: Human-readable name for the floor (e.g., 'GARM Brand Safety Floor', 'IAS Brand Safety', 'DoubleVerify Standard')

version.description: Version of the floor definition being referenced
